summary:
In Norse mythology, Valhalla is a huge hall in Asgard, ruled by the god Odin. It's where half of the warriors who die in battle go. The rest are chosen by the goddess Freyja to live in Fólkvangr. These warriors, called Einherjar, will fight alongside Odin during Ragnarök.

Valhalla has inspired many artists and is a popular symbol for honoring the dead. It's also known by different names in various Scandinavian languages.
title: Valhalla
